name: Roosta Puhkekula
description: Really nice campsite, the place also had a fantastic rope climbing course for kids (and older kids)

name: Vetsi Tall
description: Good campsite

name: Wild camp Metsapere NP
description: Lovely spot in the National Park all for ourselves

name: Free Camp in Vilsandi NP
description: in Vilsandi National Park with firewood and bbq pits, close to beach

name: Wild camping close to Nasva lighthouse
description: There is a small parking garage lot on the coast, close to the lighthouse and boat warehouse. Free. No amenities. Some people are fishing around.

name: Parking Lot - Kasari Bridge
description: Gravel parking lot next to the Kasari bridge. Safe and quiet, but a lot of mosquitoes. It is possible to get into the river on the other side of the bridge. Free.

name: Laulasmaa Side camping
description: A nice place with rooms for rent and grassy area for caravans and campers. Nice kitchen, but shower, playground for kids, basketball and volleyball. WC is quite far but clean. Free Wi-Fi. About 1km walk to the beach. A lot of mosquitoes! Paid 16 Euros for 3 people, a car+caravan.

name: Kure Turismitalu
description: Nice place but the woman who runs it is very unpleasant and seems to be angry you came here. We stayed just because we were tired and didn't want to move. She said we can use the kitchen and then refused, when I insisted she said it's OK, but showed that she was really unhappy about it, so we didn't go there as it didn't feel good. Inter. Internet was also coming and going and she wasn't helpful about it either. Not recommended, unless you don't find another place. 15 Euros por caravan and 3 people. 2 Euros for the shower per person. 3 Euros for electricity.

name: Doberani camping
description: Small place on the water. Trees, grass, muddy water, windy. Nothing special just row of camp spots. Walking distance to golf course. Kitesurfing possible but treeline very close to beach

name: haapsalu center parking
description: free parking in the center of Haapsalu. few meters from the castle. 100m from sea

name: turisalu parking
description: a parking in turisaku near some water falls. quiet place.

name: padise parking
description: A parking near the center of padise. quiet. a piece of grass in front of it.

name: tuhala parking
description: parking near tuhala witch's well. quiet and quite pretty view.

name: Wild camping at beach
description: Follow the road in maps.me. Its 7km from the main highway Saint Petersburg - Tallinn. Very quiet place. Absolutely nobody around. Located at a small beach. Many birds. Fore sure also mosquitos.

name: Jöiste Rand
description: Half-Free Campground. Privately operated.. Everything costs 2€ or is for free. Nice quiet and off the record of most camp-guides. Direct accsess to the beach. posibility for hiking and bike-tours.

name: Shelter with fire place in national park
description: Not sure if its an official camp side where you have to pay for. Its marked in maps.me as a fire place. Very nice and quiet location. Fire place with BBQ equipment. Pit toilet. Right next to water. Many mosquitoes.

name: Pedassaare
description: A place made of grass near a path issuing on the beach. really quiet.

name: parking in kohila
description: parking in the center near the police station. playground 20m away.

name: toila abandonned parking
description: a parking in front of an abandonned building. quiet. near playground

name: sillage parking
description: parking next to the city. access to the beach.

name: sinimae museum parking
description: the museum parking in sinimae right next to the front office. nothing fancy. just a place to crash.

name: kasepaa
description: a small place by the church. behind it. quiet. protected from most of the wind

name: elistvere
description:
the loomapark parking in elistvere is quiet and open all night and day long. quiet place.
bonus you can see squirrels and bear of the park from the parking

name: poltsamaa
description: parking by the river. quiet and nice. playground nearby.

name: kobruvere
description: track near the playground. really quiet. a lake is located not far.

name: pirita
description: parking on  the side of the road in the forest. we saw an elk here :)

name: Rongu
description: The church parking at the est City entrance is quiet place and the church is pretty

name: VihulaMoto
description:
This is a countryhouse. You can rent a room, put up your tent or park your caravan. There's plenty of room for about 10 caravans. Altough no special parking spaces have been built, you will have access to water and electricity. It's possible to use a sauna. Motorbikers are especially welcome.

You can spend time outside barbequing, sitting around a campfire, enjoy the nature or play golf at a nearby golf course.

The place is run by people who travel themselves, they understand travellers needs and help whenever possible.
Owners contakt: 
E-mail enok.vassel@gmail.com
GSM +37251922589

name: Kadriorg Park parking
description: Free parking at Kadriorg Park. Quiet at night. Museum close to the parking opens at 10, then it gets more crowded

name: RMK Campsite Koorküla Valgjärve
description: Free camp site maintained by the Latvian forestry administration. Fireplaces, picnic table, toilet and you can swim in the lake

name: streetmoto.ee
description: motorbike mechanic - all bikes. nice and helpful ppl.

name: Euro Hostel
description:
found it on booking.com - twin room 29euro - but one bed 11euro so reserved and ticked extra bed box for my daughter  - 1st night they charged me 12euro - 2nd night 11 euro.... for that price we (my daughter and i) got our own room with fridge and TV  (we didn't switch on TV assume it works though) 

shared bathroom and toilets and kitchen.  
kitchen not supplied so you will need a pot, cutlery etc. 
there is a washing machine in kitchen you are free to use for clothes.
not great English spoken but we managed :) 
there is a cafe/bar open in mornings - breakfast 4 euros including tea or filter coffee, cappaccino 1.60 but only adds 40cents to a breakfast.

I don't know local transport - but I don't think a bus stop is more than 5min walk.  Town centre about 20km.  own transport is preferable.  motorbikes are parked inside building.

name: Waide Motel
description:
nice stop for lunch
chicken pasta - 4.50 euros

I can see a lovely maintained camping area through trees as part of Motel

tent with 2 people - 12 Euros 
campers also welcome but I don't remember the price... very likely electric at sites

yes there is WiFi but I've not used it.

name: Russian-Estonian-Border
description: From Russia to Estonia as EU-Citizens: took 35 minutes at 6:00 pm. Very friendly Estonians.

name: At the Beach
description: Beautiful place directly at the Beach. Some locals come to swim. Nobody here at night. Very big rigs may have a problem with the narrow mudroad down to the beach but one can stay in a dead-end where the coordinates of this entry point to.  From there it is about 200m down the narrow mudroad to the beach. Great place!

name: Lepispea
description: Showers and toilets are ok. Very sad area: no trees, no bushes and worst no beach.

name: At the beach
description: Directly at the beach. Nobody here. No traffic at night. Big rigs may have a problem with the trees. Beautiful place.

name: WWII Artillery Bunker
description:
The entrance is on the right. About 4 little rooms. If you visit the lighthouse have a look here too. Flashlight is needed. Very sad place.
Other even more sad place: the Estonia feryy catastrophe of 1994 where nearly 1000 people died in the Baltic Sea…

name: Little Old Wool Factory
description: Very old machines. They are still producing wool. Little cafe with delicious cake. Openings see pictures.

name: Vanamoisa Caravan Park
description:
Fairly new site opened in 2015.
Not fully established as needs the trees to grow to give more shelter but everything is new and well looked after.
Nice spot to visit Tallinn by train.
Wifi throughout the camp.
Washing machine and dryer available.
Also basic log cabins to hire if you want to get out of the tent or camper for a night or two.
€22 a night in hard standing for two adults or €14 on grass camping. Electric included.
Log cabins €43 a night

name: Vabaujula beach parking
description: Good spot for one night. There is electricity on the the right side from parking. One normal 230V european plug. Not tested.

name: Vaskna järv
description: Nice official free campground. Really nice lake. Free firewood

name: Lighttower
description:
Behind the lighttower. Nice restaurant with wifi. You can see the sea from the parking.

Edit: Managed to change the icon from „wild camping“ to „informal campsite“.

name: willipu
description: Small site with a beach. Friendly owners and fair prices (5€ for a tent per person and 1€ for the shower) theres an optional sauna for €15. quiet spot on gras, not a lot of shade. Easy acces. Fine site!

name: Aleksandripub
description: Bar and guesthouse. accomondation in rooms wich contains running water shower and electricity or on cottages at summertime.

name: By the sea
description: the campsite is directly at the sea, located between the shore and the forest. there is a fireplace a table, BBQ, toilets and enough space to put up a camper or a tent. Depending on the kind of camper, big rigs could fit here. See photo attached. low hanging branches, sandy ground.

name: Pirita Harbour Camping
description: Good for campers and caravans, facilities were minimal with just a couple of toilets and showers but there was electricity and you are amongst boats and right by the ocean

name: Tallinn City Camping
description:
Just a trailer and mostly caravan camping. Some grass patches for grass camping. Payed for LR plus one person 12.- euros for one night. 
Communal showers!

name: campsite near to lake
description:
you can camp or park your car here.
nice view of freshwater lake.
few canopy built if you want to make barbeque here. toilet available but not clean.

name: Olerex Betooni
description: Gaz (propane) station with all different conectors for every country.

name: Koiguste Marina
description:
Nice and quiet marina on an isthmus. No mosquitoes, many gnats but they don't bite
All services. A bar.
New showers and sauna have been completed

name: Camping on lake near Mustvee
description: This is a small privately owned spot on the lake with a sandy beach, great for kids. He has a few little cabins and space for campers. Toilets and hot showers, an outdoor kitchen area but no wifi. He charged us 10 euros for two people. There's no power to plug in. Kind of quirky but friendly and a good location.

name: Estonian Border Waiting Area
description: It is possible to stay overnight at the Estonian Border waiting area. This is very useful if your timeslot to cross the border is in the middle of the night or early in the morning. It is quiet at night.

name: Moisa Beach
description: Nice Place directly next to the beach and next to a small pine forest. Some places in the shade. The water gets warm really fast as it is really shallow. Some locals came by for bathing.

name: Sooma national park
description:
good place for a night.
electricity at 1 point.
dry toilet
information about the national park.

name: Next to Cliff
description: Nice camping next to a 30m high cliff, there is a stairway down to the Baltic sea. Some locals around mostly for the sunset.

name: Car check inn for Tallink
description: check inn for Tallinn boats to Helsinki or Stockholm, follow the signs to D-terminal from the ring road. Toilets on the left side before the check inn.

name: At the little lake
description: Nice place with beach and a fireplace. Very clear water. Some locals bathing. Nobody here at night.

name: Next to the lake
description: Parkinglot next to a lake. Beach and fireplaces around. Some locals do fishing. No shadow.

name: Kivilõppe
description: At the end of the road there is a spot with 3 picnic tables, plenty of space to pitch a tent or you can park a camper nearby. Slept here completely undisturbed, very calm and quiet.

name: Free Camp RMK Seaside
description: RMK place with a lot of Shelters and Fireplaces direct on the Sea Border under Trees. Pit Toilet available.

name: Free Camp RMK Seaside
description:
another one of these beautiful free campsites in Estonia with all we need,
bbq pits, tables, pit toilets

name: Kärneri
description: Spot on a Lake. Quiet in the night. During the day some locals with dogs or to swim in the lake. Shelter and Fireplace.

name: Kliin
description:
Washing Machine and Dryer Service. 
Automat right side. Washservice left side.

Automat Washing €3.00 for 8kg
Dry €2.00 

Powder included

name: Pikseke Campground
description: Small campsite about 2km from the center. This campsite is green and semi-private when not full. Hot showers, possibility to rent a sauna house. some small cabins but mostly tent and motorhome campers. Friendly hosts.

name: Border between Estonia/Rus
description:
Smal Border. 2-Car lanes. We crossed this on Sunday at 4pm. No worry, and only 1-3more Cars. 

First you have to go to the Parking on Estonia side to get a "Ticket". With you Passport in the grey Building on a Automatic machine. It's free of charge. Wait until you see you Car-Number on the Display. After go to the Border.

After the Border you have to pay Toll for the Road. For our car <3,5to it was RUB 240.00
You can pay Cash or Card.

When you need a Insurance you can go to the Fuel Station after the first Villiage. There is a smal Container from BEK- Insurance snd also cheaper Fuel.

name: Saare Gas
description: You can fill here every gas bottle. We paid 10 Euro for 11litres

name: Koidu Homestay
description:
It‘s a big family house in Haapsalu where you can rent a room and use the kitchen, the living and dining room, washing machine, sauna and so on. We paid 25 € per night for 2 people and a dog in a room with private bathroom. All the above mentioned facilities were included. The owner brought us dry wood for the sauna and in the evening he came for setting up a fire in the stove!
Perfect place to relax and reorganize your stuff  😀

name: camping Place
description: From the Forest Estonia Fire places. Nice and quiet.

name: Lake with Parking
description: Next to Narva at a lake. Overnight no Problem.

name: RED ESPEROR HOSTEL
description: Is a hostel in Tallin .good ubication and have parking for motorbike . 9 euros per night .

name: boondock
description: parking place for rv, tent etc. black water dump available

name: Museum and Marina
description: 2 places fits all size of rigs: museum: good toilets and benches; marina: 2 tiny restaurants, electricity and water

name: Tallin
description: Although there is a charge of €9 for 24 hours this spot is perfect for visiting the Old Town.  It is also within walking distance to the ferry port.

name: At the beach
description: A designated parking area in the forest and meters from the beach.  Very quiet at night.  The sunrise was spectacular from here.  Lovely beach and shallow calm waters.   From the carpark you can continue along the dirt road to more parking areas with bbq spots.

name: Korgepervelokkekoht
description:
Camp right at the Border between Latvia and Estonia. 
There is a small sandy Beach, swimable River, Benches, Barbeque and firewood Hut. 
The place is maintained by the goverment I guess since in the morning workers came in a Goverment Truck and filled up the firewood. 
There is also a Pit Tiold behind the firewood hut.

name: Saaremaa
description: Situated between 2 harbours.  One still in use.  Very quiet spot.  Beautiful sunrises and sunsets and calm waters.  No problem here for big rigs.  4x4 not necessary.  Solid ground.

name: Camping Tehumardi
description: Very nice and green camsite. Some big old trees for shadow or just stay on the grass. Good leveld. Very friendly people. Good Burgers at the onby "Burger Hut". We paid 20 Euro for 2 persons, a camper and a dog. Electricity included.

name: Camp at small harbour
description: Place for up to 5 campers directly at a small harbour. Free of charge. With electricity.

name: Camping Konse
description: Campground and Hostel directly at the river. Many pitches for campers but just a little green. OK to stay for a night to visit Pärnu. About 1 km walk to downtown. Paid 20 Euro with a camper , 2 persons and a dog. electricity included.

name: Peking in Pärnu
description: Parking close to town, harbour and beaches. €2 for 24 hours

name: Rannapungerja Phukeala
description: Big area to overnight. Lost of place. Also canopies to grill. Just near a small river. Good spot to start to Russian Border. Bring musqito nets!

name: Artesian Well (Free)
description:
Great opportunity to refill your water. There is a running tab.
You might have to stand in line because the locals refill their water stocks as well.

name: Alfastrah.ru Vehicle Insurance
description: Very helpful man, spoke adequate English. For one month 4700 Roebel, about 68 Euros. There is a bankomat across the road.

name: Wildcamp next to beach
description: Nice spot for camping right next to the beach surrounded by trees.

name: Saunapunkt
description:
Lovely campsite in the green. Little playground for kids. Sauna available. 
€20 for two people and car. Electricity included. Waste water dump and fresh water, too.

name: Solar Caravan Park
description: Very nice modern facilities - everything is new. Giant solar panel arrays. Excellent bathrooms and kitchen area. 22€ for everything.

name: Finbo Cargo loading area
description:
New discount cargo vehicle service between Tallin and Helsinki. 
www.finbocargo.com
We paid 40€ for a VW camper and 3 people.
Check your confirmation to verify if it's the Muuga port - the regular passenger line still departs from the main terminal in Tallin.

name: Tahkuranna
description: Nice Place, friendly owner, 15 € per night on e nice Meadow, shower, kitchen, sauna, Fire place, very quite.

name: Mannisalu Kamping - Toila spa hotel camping
description: Probably the only official camp site on this part of coast near Narva. Use google to find it, no big signs. European standards, also with the prices (see the pictures), but we paid only 5€ for 2 persons and offroad rig with roof top tent including electricity (reduction for camper and standard plug needed!). But we easily spent the saved money in the hotel restaurant - 18€ for steak and 3,50€ for beer.

name: Kareparand beach spot
description: Nice place in the forrest just next to the beach. Only few locals for the beach walk

name: Käsmu camp - Heino Laanements
description:
Small camp at old lady. Last gate in the village next to the start of the short trail to the cape to see the Vana-jüry kivid. 
15€ for offroad with roof top tent, 2 persons and electricity. Shower for 2€/person

name: Hara
description: 10 €/ person to get to the former Soviet submarine base.

name: Matka camp Paldiski
description: Small camp next to the lighthouse on the cape. Will be opened dince 8/2019

name: Soviet pilots cementery
description: Soviet pilots cementery, buried under the wings of their planes.

name: Abula Campsite
description: One of the official camp spot in the area, with the fireplace, shelter and pit toilet. Directly on the beach, plenty of space.

name: campsite with a pond and a outhouse
description: great campsite in the forest complete with a pond, out house, and campfire pit. small shelter covering wood for the fire. outhouse is pretty nice with toilet paper and seat

name: Free Camp RMK Seaside
description: Nice place with fire pit, fire wood, pit toilet and picnic table. Well maintained like every RMK-Place we were! There are  spots along the coast. Look for the wooden tent sign. At this one we could park our van direct at the fire pit and beach. There is also a small lake next to this spot and a lost solar shower:-) Enjoy.

name: Parking lot next to the ferry
description: Big parking lot for 3.50Euro/24h. Good Wifi next to the hotel. Big shopping center with toilets (9am to 8pm). Small walk to old town. Good for one night:-)

name: RMK - free camping
description: Free, state-run camping - similar to state parks in USA. Long drop toilet, fire pits, covered seating, and grassy spots, protected by trees and very close to beach. cell phone coverage is spotty.  Take a walk to the end of the peninsula!

name: Picnic place at the peipus sea
description:
Sweet place at the shore of the peipus sea. It has tables, two ovens to grill and a playground for children.
Enough space for camps and campers. We were two cars.
Beautiful sunrise!

name: Nigula Bog Excursion Path
description: The Nigula Nature Reserve was established in1957. Today the natural bog and vast Virgin Forrest massifs are protected. Tour takes 2 hours.

name: Nigula Information Center
description: Wide area at the Information Center of the Nature Reserve.

name: Kampingud
description: Terrific campground along the lake, with 3 small cabins. Free wood, free power, free use of kayaks and canoes. Nice trees, picnic tables, and fire pits. €5 per tent or camper.  We were 4 people, 1 tent and 1 camping car, total was 10€. Nice owners.+372-528-8375

name: Metsakula
description: Small place next to a gravelroad right by a small lake. Gravelroad has some traffic, but the spot is very quiet at night. Good for staying a night.

name: Near surfers paradise
description: Several beautiful spots right on the pebble beach. Bumpy road to the surfers place.

name: 24h parking
description:
Parking lot, 2€ for 24 hours, no facilities. Close to the sea, 10 mins walk to the old town. Nice restaurant right around the corner.
We didn't see any security, but it seemed safe (expensive cars on the parking lot).
 Also several other campers who slept here. 
ONLY COIN PAYMENT!

name: Kirkumäe lake
description:
A small informal campsite for a maximum of one to two cars right next to a lake. There is a firepit and some firewood available. There is also a hiking trail around the lake.
Quiet, clean and peaceful place in a small village.

name: Rakvere Spordikeskus shower
description: Shower possible for 2 euro at the sports center.

name: Freedom 65 Hostel and Caravan
description: Place at 7km from the center. Good if you have vehicule. Big rig, car, motorcycle... big house with huge parking and garden. Minimarket nearby. Cheap 8€ bed in dorm of 8. Cash or credit card. Booking.com. Only one thing which not welcoming no commun area inside. Outside plainty but when it’s cold... also kitchen is just microwave and bold water, there isn’t even a sink. Bottle water and beer at available at the reception. So finally good for a one night stop before ferry not to chill, or during summer.

name: Oru Park official Parking
description: We slept here one night for free and it was very quiet. Its near a beautiful park where you can go for a walk.

name: Hot shower
description:
In this Fitness-Area you can ask for a shower. We paid 2 Euro p. P.
The first 3 hours of the parking area are for free, just put the blue parking thing

name: Parking place in Nationalpark
description: Quiet Parking near Naturecenter of Oandu. Pit toilets also aviable.

name: Oandu Naturecenter
description: Beautiful Naturecenter whit free exipitions. Perfect maintained Hiking Trails starts from here.

name: Majakivi Nature Trail
description:
The Lahemaa Nationalpark has several trails to hike, but this one is one of the beautifullest! A 6.1km hike leeds you to the third biggest erratic in Estonia and to a 16m sightseeing tower. Just amazing!
We slept here on the official parking and it was out of season, dont know how id is during high season. Its directly on the Street but the traffic was very moderate. Pit toilets also aviable. Enjoy!

name: V - Vegan Restoran
description:
Very good food and friendly staff. The Burger is just mindblowing!
You should call for a reservation cause its a very small restaurant +372 626 9087 or write at reserve	@veganrestoran.ee

name: Kanepi wc
description: Fresh water tap behind church inside a public toilet.

name: Luite lõkkekoht
description:
Firewood, shelter,fireplace, wc. 
no water

name: Homestay Metsaveere Turismitalu
description: Peaceful and cozy acommodation. Friendly owners.

name: Rmk Tudu metsaonn
description:
MODERATOR NOTE: Not sure if accessible with vehicle and camping

Basic but warm cottage next to a lake. Accessible by bicycle. Suitable even in spring and autumn. Free- provided by Rmk.

name: Matsu talu - Matsu guest house
description: Cozy accommodation at the farm. They have a range of places to stay. 25 euros is in main house with shared shower and WC. Clean!

name: Illuka mõis -Illuka manor
description: Beautiful old manor with guest house and hostel part. 2 person room with shared shower and wc is 10 euros per person. Place is modern, clean and renovated. Guesthouse part has kitchen.

name: Kääriku spordibaas
description: There is hostel also. We stayed in tent - 5 euros per tent! Hot shower in main building up from stairs on top of hill. On one evening there was even sauna at showers. Level ground and beautiful lake. For 6.50 breakfast buffet.

name: Kaldavere Tourism Farm - Kaldavere turismitalu
description: Beautiful small farm, has different acommodation options starying from 15 euros.

name: Kivimäe turismitalu
description: Has cabins 15 euros per person. Cozy, shower for extra pay.

name: White house
description: Huge campground. Good for tents and campervans. 7 euros per person. Shower was hot and owner friendly.

name: Camping Esplanaadi
description: Lovely lady runs the place. 8 euros per person.

name: Rmk lõkkekoht
description: Very nice place right at sea. Bbq and picnic tables.

name: Free Camping Near the Lake
description:
Very good spots do camp free at Lake Peipus.
This lake makes border with Russia. Site located between Rannapungerja and Lohusuu.
You enter 500 m from the E 264 in a dirt road in the middle of the forest.
There are picnic tables and benches.
Pit fire places to make a barbecue.
Pit toilets also available.

name: RMK Juminda
description:
Little campsite from RMK Lahemaa National Parc.
Some space for tents and car. Fire places. 
Next to the Baltic Sea. No beach. Lots of big stones!
Memorial of sunken ships from WWII next to the campsite. 
Pit toilet very dirty, no firewood in the boxes, trash container was already overloaded.

name: Mändjala Kämping
description:
Very nice place. Huge camping. Little bar with hammocks at the beach. 
With tent you can stand right behind some small dunes. You can still see the Baltic Sea. With larger vehicles you have to stand further away.
Only one house with shower quite far away from our place. A toilet house with about 5 toilets each for women and men. 
Nice lady at the reception. 
Long beach, but a lot of grass so you can't really go swimming here.

name: Laidunina lighthouse
description: Abandoned lighthouse. Possible to sleep under roof in side building.

name: Beautiful peninsula
description: Aceccible on foot and bicycle. Few bences to sit on. flat laen to pitch a tent.

name: Salamaa Camping, Taevaskoja
description: Deep in the woods, appr 40 km from Tartu, is this well equipped camping. Large, nice place with all the things campers might need. Very friendly people, they speak some english. We payed €20 pn, 2 adults, 1 camper, electricity. There's even a washing machine for your laundry; and the kitchen is equipped with pots and plates. Fireplaces, BBQ possible, sauna. Rent rooms, too.

name: Kliin laundromat
description: Laundromat next to a shopping center. Different washers/dryers, to operate with coin or card. Open 7 days a week, closes already 18.00.

name: Beach wild parking
description:
Close to the lighthouse, just 50m off the road a wild camping spot. You can be privet and enjoy the beach to yourself.
Availible rock made fire space.
Access road is ok, the car needs some clearance.

name: small lighthouse
description: A nice private spot next to a small lighthouse. Road to it is gravel, seems to get little visitors

name: RMK Iljaste
description:
A bench, a table, a bbq, pit toilet and a place for 4 tents.
10 meter from the lake.
a small route nearby.
no water.
also a parking area where you can spend the night.

name: Parking free
description:
A Parking Lot in the center of the town. It is free. Also to stay over night.
There is one more at the beach, witch could get noisy at the weekends.

name: Saka Cliff Hotel & SPA
description:
Nice grassy campground at the hotel.
They carge 15,-€ per night for 1 Camper and one Person.
There is a SPA wich you can use for 10,-€ 1.5 hours. Also they have a restaurant.
Electicity, Toilette and Shower are included.
Unfortunately the wifi does not reach the campground, works just at the reception

name: Kublitsa Campsite
description: Fire pit, shelter, little lake, dry toilet. Free

name: Farm
description:
Host super friendly, great place to chill and relax.
Showers, toilets and everything else very very clean. 
Tent places, as well as cabins and campers have also place to park.
Place can be recommended without any hesitation.

name: Free parking lot without a Name
description: Parking lot 15 minutes from the city of Tarku. We stay here some hours for visiting the city. Other travellers stay here over night.

name: Valgevälja Karjäär
description: Stayed one night. Close to Haapsalu next to a small lake. Lots of local taking a swim or a boat trip. Plenty of mosquitos at night and some noise from road 31 and a bit of rubbish.

name: Public shower
description:
Public shower. 1,30€ per person until hot water stops :-) 
Inside of yellow toilet building. Lady speaks Estonian or Russian.
Toilet is 0,50€.
All very clean. Friendly place!

name: Framare Thalasso Day Spa
description:
Day Spa of the Framare Hotel. The ticket for a full day is 15€ and you can stay as long as you want. There are 6 (six!) different (!) saunas (including steam bath, salt scrub, infrared etc.), an indoor pool, a whirlpool, an outdoor pool etc. and endless good showers. Cold and hot drinking water included, bring some snacks if you want to stay the whole day, there is no bar/restaurant. 
Afterwards you may sleep on the attached beach-parking. There is a clean toilet that seems to be closed at night.

name: Texas Cantina
description:
The best tex-mex cantina in town.
Good food, friendly service, large margaritas.

name: RMK Muinasküla
description: Beautiful site with wood, fireplace,dry toilet and floating sauna! Just open the gate to get in.

name: Tallinn
description: Great hostel, more like a hotel.  We paid 26 € for a double room with shared bathroom.  Several parking spaces under the hostel, right on the main road, by the reception window.  The facility is well-equipped, there is even a sauna and a small swimming pool.  We had a small electric heater in the room to keep warm or dry. The old town of Tallinn is about 5 minutes' walk from the hostel.

name: Tänavjärve lõkkekoht
description: Nice spot next to a beautiful lake, has sandy shores, perfect for swimming. Needs a 4x4 to get there!

name: Vanatammi
description: Private lawn camping with a campfire, possibility to swim in the river. Phone 3725010491

name: Penijõgi camping site
description:
Covered campfire grill, 3 covered tables, 2-seater outdoor toilet, rubbish bin with sorting instructions. Place for many tents 

Check website for more details

name: Parking near the beach
description: Nice large parking lot with shade from the trees.

name: Pangodi lake
description: A RMK place, meaning official spot to spend the night. sheltered tables, fire places, pit toilets, swimming place.

name: Mereoja Camping
description: A very good established campsite, with nice kitchen and modern toilets/showers. Everything very clean. Quiet. 26€ for 4 people in tent for a night.

name: river camp
description: Nice place with table, fireplaces wtih barbecue stuff, river and pit toilets

name: War memorial slightly off the road without a car
description: 50m into the forest, nothing fancy but better to spend one night here than directly by the road anywhere along it from Narva. Cars have to park by the road. Dense forests and many water bodies all over, mosquitos granted.

name: Ermistu Puhkeküla
description:
Great campground directly at the lake with a sandy beach, kidsfriendly. Facilities are new and realy clean. Boat rental is possible and you can ask for a permit to catch fish. Perfect spot to stay some days. Washing machine is also available, one load 4€. Emty during the week.
Nicest sunset.

name: Kämping
description:
Still under construction, but shower and toiletts are ready for usage. 4 little cabins for rental. 
Officially not open yet, but they kindly rented me one hut as the next camping had a concert. Very nice owner, she speaks a little bit english.
Someone needs to review it please after finished.

name: Drinkwater at harbour
description: A tap on a small red building next to the water. It has a sign "joogivesi", meaning drinkwater.

name: Campspot at Sarapiku järv
description:
Nice campspot at the lake. There are benches, a firepit and there was even some firewood when we were there.

If you are coming from the side of the road that runs along the lake, you need a 4x4 with ground clearance. The last part along the lake has big holes and is muddy on parts. From the other side its easier to reach the spot. It's a short drive over a sandy forest road, but not bad. Also possible without 4wd (at least in dry weather).

name: local campsite
description: local government campsite. nice place by the sea

name: Oil Shale
description: great area to Camp and swim. plenty of space.  it is an renaturated oil shlade mine. now good for camper and watersports. 4G one bar

name: camping
description: great campsite, really nicely maintained, cooking hob/ fridge/ kettle provided. short walk to beach. 9 euros per person with tent per night. highly recommended

name: On the cliffs
description: Very nice spot with view on the Baltic sea and Tallinn in the very back. Only for tents.

name: Keibu Bay lõkkekoht
description: There are several lõkkekohts close. Beautiful free camp spots in the wood with pit toilets, fire places, firewood and a stunning beach close!

name: RMK Oksa lõkkekoht
description: Nice shelter in Soomaa National Park with pit toilet, fireplace and firewood and benches with roof. There is another spot 200 meters after and one 200 meters before at the road.

name: RMK lõkkekoht in the wood
description: Fireplace with pit toilet and camp spots in the woods. You can get there by car, but with a big camper it could be difficult.

name: Alakonnu campfire site
description: Beautiful spot next to a lake with pit toilet, fireplace and shelter. There are several similar spots around the lake!

name: beach camp
description: Shallow, sandy swimming beach with small bench, fresh water source (would filter to be safe), volleyball net and dry toilet. Small camp fire site and lots of flat grass to pitch tents

name: Aki Kamping
description: campsite with field for tents, hook ups for vans and caravans and small huts with beds. fire pits, communal kitchen, shared toilets and shower. informal and just off the main road, next to the church and school. closed during off season

name: Vanaluubi rest area
description: Free camping with covered beaches, dry toilet, fire/grill stands right next to the water. very peaceful with a small car park and a few boats moored in the reeds

name: Maria Talu
description: Cabins, tent and caravan space, pretty touristy with traditional farm and restaurant

name: Parking Area
description:
Free parking, huge space.
Park next to boats at the museum.

Visit the ford and abandoned prison.
Amazing urban surroundings.

1.4 km to the old city of Tallin
800 meters to excelent kebab.

Cool warships you can watch behind the museum. In the daytime, busy, can be loud. Quiet at night.

name: parking near the monastery
description:
parking near the monastery.
in winter out of session the toilets are closed.

in summer there is a icr cream seller also.
verry quit at night.
small walk to the monastery.

name: parking near the border
description:
briljant spot.

a parking free and allowed by goverment / tourism to stay overnight.

park youre van right en you see the russian flag on the building across the river / border.

old town / defense walls / hike trail / koffie machine 1 euro.
toilets near the boulevard.
restaurant 50 meters

realy nice.

name: RMK Karjamaa
description:
buitifull spot in tge woods.
but a 25 meter walk to the water / lake.

there are sevaral small beaches.
swimming / fishing.

fire places availble also a waterpump.
dont now if you can drink it.

wake up with the sound of birds.

RMK are official wild camping places from Estonia goverment.

name: Tires - Rehvid.com
description: You can find all sort of tyres and fit to your vehicle too. Online ordering is possible and their prices are fair.

name: Tritse Rmk free camping
description:
A nice free camping spot on the beach. all the usual RmK facilities plus a nice walk through the forest. 
I stayed on a Friday night and it was busy the family's walking and People cooking. lateer in the evening young people tuned up and were noisy for a while but it was fine.

name: ferry boat to Saaremaa island
description:
Many crossings per day and departures on time.  
About 30-35 min crossing. 
Timetables and prices on the website www.praamid.ee

name: next to Ermistu lake
description:
At the end of the path there is a bench with a table and the possibility of putting one or two tents. 
Access to the lake difficult: mud and lots of reeds. 
Quiet place : only a few fishermen come to drop off a boat before going on the water

name: Lux Glamping Lammas
description:
Luxury glamping and camping. Bike and canoo rental available.

https://lammastelk.webnode.page

name: Triigi Campsite
description: Seaside RMK Campsite in Triigi, near the ferry to Hiiumaa. Some picnic tables and grills for barbecue. Just for tents (car, motorcycle, bicycle, on foot). Small place, not for RVs and motor homes.

name: campsite Randmäe Puhketalu
description:
Quiet campsite close to the beach and the sea. 
for a tent : 6€/pp
for a caravan : 25€

the toilets are simple but sufficient. Access to a well equipped kitchen.

negative point: there is little shade

wifi available at the reception. No restaurant when we were there

name: Restored old water tap
description: Drinking water at Kuressaare out of a well which was build after first world war. It was restored in 2007 for the 444th aniversery of the town.

name: Mändjala Beach
description: Beachsite Camping under Pine trees at a Kiosk which was closed. Volleyball net. 50 m back is a clearing for more space. Sand is a bit overgrown. Water shallow.

name: Free RMK for cars also
description: Close to see and lighthouse. Quiet. Pit toilet and Bench. Fireplace. Both shade and sun. Not at all windy.

name: Juminda Poolsaar
description: Quiet place in the Juminda National park. Space enough for two campers. Pit Toilet and container for litter. Fire not allowed.

name: RMK Rae järve talkimisala
description: RMK site with lots of spaces. 4 fire pits, 3 or 4 bench shelters. Close to the water and some hiking trails. Water available from a well with hand pump. 2 toilet blocks are present.

name: Uue-Jaani Talu Camping
description:
New beautiful caravan area is complete! 
Come look what has been made out of famous Estonian demolished buildings (Tallinn University, Kalev Spa, etc). We also have a Museum and a "Sustainable Lifestyle Center".
We love recycling, bringing new life to old things and keeping the legacy alive.

Free electricity, hot shower, toilets, lake for swimming, forest for walking/cycling/hiking.

25€/night

name: Uue-Jaani Talu Guesthouse
description:
Luxorious Villa next to the Latvian border in Estonia. The best place to relax, spend your vacation, host events and have parties. Very big open area for even the biggest events you can think of. 
Check availability via booking.com or come check out our Farm Museum and maybe stay a night camping.

name: Mustvee lakesite
description: Nice open place for campers at the lakeside in Mustvee with toilet.

name: Spring Water
description: Water comes from a hose near a former electricity plant. According to the RMK app, it's potable water from a spring. You can drive down from the bridge with a not too high vehicle, but need to brave driving under fallen trees and a rotting overpass.

name: Spring near river
description: In the parking lot, turn right from the driveway and the spring is behind the fence. The spring is used by locals for drinking water. sometimes some cars parked in front of the access.

name: Great place at the sea
description: Big stony place near the sea. A bit ground clearance and 4x4 after muddy weather are recommended.

name: Virtsu Old Railway
description: Place for parking overnight when nearby offical campsite is full.  Very narrow road and bridge as it was old narrow gauge railway, so 2,4m is widest car allowed here. Be careful not to block fishermen to access sea by boat trailers as they are coming early in the morning. It is possible to swim here also.

name: RMK Elda campsite
description:
Official campsite by Estonian State Forest Management Centre (RMK)  Big parking area, 2 tables, fireplace and prepared firewood, trash containers and toilet. Seaview is blocked by forest, otherwise very good quiet place to stay.
You can find all RMK campsites and hiking trails here: https://rmk-loodusegakoos-veebikaart.rmk.ee/

name: Raudna
description: Very nice and beautiful lake, with different places for swimming and camping.

name: Roadside
description: Quiet place near the road from Tartu to Tallinn next to an abandoned house in the middle of fields.

name: Tehumardi Wild Camping
description:
Behind the monument next to the sea is a great place for wild camping, it is only accessible by foot or bicycle.

No toilets or drinkable water, just a camping place

name: Kodavere
description: Nice place at the Peippsi Lake. Campground is in development. Showers kitchen etc are coming. Toilet en two clean pittoilets. Kind owner.

name: Astanimaja apartments
description: Very nice big room , wifi , kitchen all everything for 34 euros , and also private safe parking . Near to city center
